prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a rectangular metal plate with four holes, two on each side, arranged in a square pattern. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.3, 0.0]. Next, create the 2D sketch for the metal plate. On the XY plane, draw a rectangle with vertices at the following coordinates (0.0, 0.0), (0.75, 0.0), (0.75, 0.75), (0.0, 0.75), and (0.0, 0.0), creating `face_1`. Then, create `loop_1` by adding lines between the following vertices: (0.0, 0.0), (0.75, 0.0), (0.75, 0.375), (0.75, 0.75), and (0.0, 0.75). Now, create `loop_2` by adding the following features: 1. A line connecting the points (0.075, 0.1125) and (0.075, 0.375). 2. A line connecting the points (0.075, 0.375) and (0.075, 0.6375). 3. An arc with its start point at (0.075, 0.6375), mid point at (0.0485, 0.7015), and end point at (0.1125, 0.675). 4. A line connecting the points (0.1125, 0.675) and (0.6375, 0.675). 5. An arc with its start point at (0.6375, 0.675), mid point at (0.7015, 0.7015), and end point at (0.675, 0.6375). 6. A line connecting the points (0.675, 0.6375) and (0.675, 0.375). 7. A line connecting the points (0.675, 0.375) and (0.675, 0.1125). 8. An arc with its start point at (0.675, 0.1125), mid point at (0.7015, 0.0485), and end point at (0.6375, 0.075). 9. A line connecting the points (0.6375, 0.075) and (0.1125, 0.075). 10. An arc with its start point at (0.1125, 0.075), mid point at (0.1015, 0.1015), and end point at (0.075, 0.1125). `loop_2` forms the outline of the four holes in the metal plate. Finally, create the 3D sketch by transforming the 2D sketch using the coordinate system information provided. Use a scaling factor of 0.75, defined by the `sketch_scale` parameter. Extrude the 2D sketch using the specified extrusion parameters: a normal-depth of 0.3, and an opposite-normal depth of 0.0. Please note that this specific part does not affect preceding CAD models, but instead creates a new metal plate solid body, as per the "operation" parameter value "NewBodyFeatureOperation".</description>

Create a new coordinate system with euler angles at 0° in all X, Y, and Z axes and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. 2. For the first face of the prism: - Create a loop consisting of 4 lines: - Line 1: Starting at [0, 0.0052], ending at [0.073, 0.0052] - Line 2: Starting at [0.073, 0.0052], ending at [0.073, 0.0417] - Line 3: Starting at [0.073, 0.0417], ending at [0, 0.0417] - Line 4: Starting at [0, 0.0417], ending at [0, 0.0052] 3. For the second face of the prism: - Create a loop consisting of 4 lines: - Line 1: Starting at [0.6543, 0], ending at [0.75, 0] - Line 2: Starting at [0.75, 0], ending at [0.75, 0.0469] - Line 3: Starting at [0.75, 0.0469], ending at [0.6543, 0.0469] - Line 4: Starting at [0.6543, 0.0469], ending at [0.6543, 0] 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles of [0, 0, 0] and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. 6. Extrude the sketch to a depth of 0.0182 units towards the normal, creating a 3D model. This completes the construction of the larger rectangular prism, with dimensions of approximately 0.073 units in length, 0.0469 units in width, and 0.0182 units in height. This serves as the base for the remaining components.</description>
